newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end slightly lower on slumping Dow.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end slightly lower on slumping Dow.

text.p: Brazilian stocks closed slightly lower in moderate trade, following weakness on Wall Street, traders said.
"It was a slow day and there's been no local news to trade on. We followed weakness in Telebras ADRs in New York," said one trader.
The Bovespa index of the 55 most-active stocks ended down 0.31 percent to close at 66,311. Volume stood at 396 million reais ($386.8 million).
Benchmark Telebras preferred ended the day at 81.60, down 0.97 percent, while its voting common stock closed down 0.15 percent at 68.30.
State oil firm Petrobras preferred shares fell 0.41 percent to close at 122.
The bolsa's Electrical Energy Index (IEE) rose 0.09 percent to end at 1,692 points. The index includes the nine most liquid power stocks.
The IEE was boosted by federally owned power firm Eletrobras, whose preferred shares rose 1.95 percent to close at 313 following news the company would be issuing level three ADRs.
Traders said the market would continue to look to New York for direction on Thursday.
